revision.text: {{see also|Yānshān}} ==English== {{wikipedia|Yan Mountains}} ===Etymology=== From the [[pinyin]] romanization of the {{der|en|cmn|-}} pronunciation of {{der|en|zh|燕山||tr=Yānshān}}. ===Proper noun=== {{en-proper noun}} # {{syn of|en|Yan|nodot=a}} '''[[mountains|Mountains]]'''. #* {{quote-book |en |year=1988 |title=The Great Tangshan Earthquake of 1976: An Anatomy of Disaster |url=https://archive.org/details/greattangshanear0000unse/ |publisher={{w|Pergamon Press}} |ISBN=0-08-034875-0 |LCCN=88-5916 |OCLC=17618982 |OL=2030428M |page=3 |pageurl=https://archive.org/details/greattangshanear0000unse/page/3/ |text=The geomorphology has been modified by the flow of Luanhe and several other major rivers which run through the '''Yanshan''' mountains and the plain to reach Bohai. }} ====Usage notes==== Often redundantly expressed in English as the "Yanshan Mountains".
